BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind and new snow above the tree line: Dry avalanches at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of new snow and a moderate to strong wind, sometimes large wind slabs formed in the last two days in high Alpine regions. Wind slabs can be released, even by a single winter sport participant.
Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are possible in particular on steep sunny slopes.
In particular low altitudes: On very steep grassy slopes these can slide on the ground.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: 20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. Above approximately 2000 m there is still a very large amount of snow.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The new snow of the last few days represents the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh snow as well as the sometimes large wind slabs formed during the snowfall must be evaluated with care and prudence.
Avalanches are possible as the day progresses, even large ones in isolated cases, in the regions exposed to heavier precipitation caution is to be exercised on steep sunny slopes.
The new snow and wind slabs can be released by a single winter sport participant.
The current avalanche situation calls for careful route selection.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: 20 to 40 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, will fall until midday. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions there is still a very large amount of snow. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Decrease in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of warming.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs can still be released in some cases on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. In isolated cases avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach medium size. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m, as well as on steep shady slopes below approximately 2400 m.

As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural activity of medium loose snow avalanches will appreciably increase, especially in extremely steep terrain in all aspects. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

On steep grassy slopes more frequent medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular on steep, snow-free grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Over a wide area 10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. Less snow than expected has fallen in the Vinschgau.

After a clear night, it will be sunny and very mild during the day. These meteorological conditions will bring about a substantial stabilisation of the near-surface layers on steep shady slopes.
Steep east, south and west facing slopes: Here, the new snow layer becomes completely wet during the course of the day.

The old snowpack is wet. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Increase in danger of wet avalanches as a consequence of warming.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The fresh snow and the sometimes large wind slabs can be released easily or naturally in all aspects.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. Below approximately 2800 m medium-sized to large wet loose snow avalanches are possible. In particular in gullies and bowls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain sometimes large wind slabs formed.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Towards its surface, the snowpack is moist and its surface has a strong crust. As the day progresses as a consequence of warming during the day there will be an increase in the danger of moist and wet avalanches. In particular adjacent to ridgelines as well as at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions sometimes avalanche prone wind slabs formed.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: As a consequence of new snow and wind, wind slabs formed especially at intermediate and high altitudes.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The new snow and wind slabs can be released easily at intermediate and high altitudes.
Along the border with France a considerable avalanche danger will persist in some regions.
In isolated cases the avalanches are medium-sized but can be released also by a single winter sport participant. In the regions exposed to heavier precipitation this applies in particular on very steep slopes.
Gradual increase in danger of wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: 15 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen above approximately 2000 m. In particular at high altitudes and in high Alpine regions there is still a very large amount of snow. The spring-like weather conditions gave rise to increasing settling of the snowpack in particular at low and intermediate altitudes. The rain gave rise on Tuesday to thorough wetting of the snowpack below the tree line.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: New snow, wind slabs and old snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Over a wide area over a wide area 10 to 25 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. The clearly visible wind slabs must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects at high altitude. Backcountry tourers or freeriders can release avalanches easily. Medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large natural avalanches are not ruled out. This applies in particular on very steep slopes above approximately 1900 m, as well as at the base of rock walls. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: The sometimes strong wind has transported the new snow. The surface of the snowpack will soften during the day. As a consequence of warming during the day the avalanche prone locations will become more prevalent as the day progresses. The new snow of yesterday must be evaluated with care and prudence in all aspects above approximately 1900 m.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Decrease in danger of dry avalanches as a consequence of warming.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
The fresh snow and the mostly small wind slabs can still be released in some cases on very steep shady slopes above approximately 2200 m. In isolated cases avalanches can release the saturated snowpack and reach medium size. This applies in particular on steep sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m, as well as on steep shady slopes below approximately 2400 m.

As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the natural activity of medium loose snow avalanches will appreciably increase, especially in extremely steep terrain in all aspects. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.

On steep grassy slopes more frequent medium-sized gliding avalanches are possible below approximately 2600 m. This applies in particular on steep, snow-free grassy slopes below approximately 2600 m. Areas with glide cracks are to be avoided.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Over a wide area 10 to 20 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, has fallen. Less snow than expected has fallen in the Vinschgau.

After a clear night, it will be sunny and very mild during the day. These meteorological conditions will bring about a substantial stabilisation of the near-surface layers on steep shady slopes.
Steep east, south and west facing slopes: Here, the new snow layer becomes completely wet during the course of the day.

The old snowpack is wet. This applies in particular on sunny slopes below approximately 2800 m, as well as on shady slopes below approximately 2400 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Increase in danger of wet avalanches as a consequence of warming.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the last two days the wind was moderate to strong in particular along the border with Switzerland and along the border with France. On Wednesday small wind slabs formed. They are easy to recognise. The fresh wind slabs can in isolated cases be released by a single winter sport participant. These avalanche prone locations are to be found especially on very steep slopes above approximately 2600 m and adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.

Below approximately 2900 m small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Tuesday above approximately 2400 m. Isolated occasionally large moist avalanches have been released as a consequence of the rain.
As a consequence of falling temperatures a quite favourable avalanche situation developed on Wednesday.
Early morning: In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
During the day: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise to rapid moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2900 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The backcountry touring conditions in the morning, after a clear night, are favourable. Significant increase in danger of wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wind slabs and wet snow represent the main danger.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
In the last two days the wind was moderate to strong in particular along the border with Switzerland and along the border with France. On Wednesday small wind slabs formed. They are easy to recognise. The fresh wind slabs can in isolated cases be released by a single winter sport participant. These avalanche prone locations are to be found especially on very steep slopes above approximately 2600 m and adjacent to ridgelines and in pass areas.

Below approximately 2900 m small and medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible as a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation. Apart from the danger of being buried, restraint should be exercised in particular in view of the danger of avalanches sweeping people along and giving rise to falls.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
20 to 30 cm of snow, and even more in some localities, fell on Tuesday above approximately 2400 m. Isolated occasionally large moist avalanches have been released as a consequence of the rain.
As a consequence of falling temperatures a quite favourable avalanche situation developed on Wednesday.
Early morning: In steep terrain there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface.
During the day: Sunshine and high temperatures will give rise to rapid moistening of the snowpack below approximately 2900 m.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The backcountry touring conditions in the morning, after a clear night, are favourable. Significant increase in danger of wet avalanches as a consequence of warming during the day.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Weakly bonded old snow and wet snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming during the day and solar radiation small to medium-sized moist and wet avalanches are possible above approximately 1700 m. In particular on shady slopes the avalanches can penetrate even deep layers. Weakly bonded old snow and wet snow require caution.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: In some localities 0 to 2 cm of snow has fallen above approximately 2000 m. The snowpack will be generally moist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The prevalence of the avalanche prone locations will increase as the day progresses. Backcountry tours should be started and concluded early. In many places there is a danger of falling on the hard snow surface. In the event of a clear night this applies in particular in the early morning.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment:
As a consequence of warming during the day and the solar radiation, the likelihood of moist and wet avalanches being released will increase in all aspects. The avalanche prone locations are to be found at the base of rock walls and behind abrupt changes in the terrain and adjacent to ridgelines and in gullies and bowls. Gliding avalanches can also occur, in particular on steep grassy slopes.
The wind slabs remain for the foreseeable future prone to triggering, especially adjacent to ridgelines. In all regions medium-sized and, in isolated cases, large avalanches are possible.
Avalanches can be released, mostly by large loads.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Up to high altitudes rain has fallen over a wide area. The weather conditions gave rise to thorough wetting of the snowpack over a wide area.
Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be quite good. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be mostly sunny. Over a wide area further warming.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: Wet snow slides and avalanches are possible in isolated cases. Mostly these are small.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: Above approximately 2000 m: In gullies and bowls mostly small wet snow slides and avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Below approximately 1900 m hardly any snow is lying. The old snowpack will be subject to considerable local variations. The older wind slabs are to be found especially in gullies and bowls and at high altitudes. The snowpack will be generally moist.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be very warm. The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of wet avalanches will gradually increase. On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Some snow fell on Wednesday in some localities. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning.

Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Conditions are favorable concerning avalanche hazard.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be mostly sunny.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: The avalanche prone locations are to be found in particular on shady slopes at intermediate and high altitudes. Mostly small avalanches are possible in particular on steep shady slopes. Avalanches can be released, mostly by large loads in isolated cases.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment: Outgoing longwave radiation during the night will be good. The surface of the snowpack will freeze to form a strong crust and will soften during the day. On sunny slopes hardly any snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: The weather will be mostly sunny. Over a wide area further warming.

BulletinMeasurements.avActivityHighlights: The weather will be very warm. The danger of wet avalanches will increase during the day.
BulletinMeasurements.avActivityComment: As a consequence of warming and solar radiation, the activity of wet avalanches will gradually increase. On steep grassy slopes mostly small gliding avalanches are possible.
BulletinMeasurements.snowpackStructureComment:
Some snow fell on Wednesday in some localities. The surface of the snowpack will freeze very little and will already be soft in the early morning.

Below approximately 1800 m from a snow sport perspective, in most cases insufficient snow is lying.
BulletinMeasurements.tendencyComment: Conditions are favorable concerning avalanche hazard.
